EXTRACTED VALUE: A frustratingly straightforward game to rate, courtesy of the fact that it sells for at least twice the price it should. [Issue 20, p.64]
This is not the kind of game you'll pull out after the Olympics have ended.
A lukewarm experiment, and while a partner is required for fun, everything is fun with two. [Oct 2008, p.102]
Nice graphics and smooth gameplay are no substitute for imagination.
It's disappointing to get a same old game on a fresh new platform. [Holiday 2005, p.80]
It's so colorful that it's likely to lure people of all ages in and keep them hooked. [Issue#29, p.120]
Interesting online modes salvage this derivative street racer from total mediocrity.
Fresh ideas can't save Bladestorm from mediocrity.
Live feels like a major step back in the wrong direction and feels about as shallow as a kiddy pool.
Uncomplicated, and great for younger gamers and Sega fanboys alike. Instantly playable and with plenty to wave your racket at.
Midway ports the Blitz on the 360, but doesn't feature anything new, apart from visual improvements here and there. Get it only if you didn't already.
Inventory restrictions, abundance of backtracking and run of the mill production values make things pretty average.
All in all, if put into one word this game is bland.
